director amy heckerling knows thing two about high school flicks having directed highly successful fast times ridgemont high heckerling put her talents work thirteen years later next generation high schoolers writing directing hilarious satire life beverly hills hs heckerling takes different approach fast times which found its comedy absurdity reality depicting situations into which teenagers really get themselves here heckerlings comedy mostly comes mocking superficiality high school incrowd while not first time has been done few have ever done such blistering wit film became standard spate 1990s high school flicks set west coast borrowed many its elements

story focuses cher horowitz alicia silverstone who most popular girl beverly hills hs cher seems superficial airhead but belies her conniving manipulative skills getting what she wants superficial yes airhead no plot derived part jane austens emma cher works behind scenes arrange love matches between various students she even orchestrates relationship between two teachers improve their moods so they dont grade so harshly like emma she master love everyone but herself

heckerling does fantastic job presenting what seems surface cotton candy story lightweight characters but really runs much deeper revealing subtle truths about human nature her direction fledgling cast superb milking every ounce comedy out each scene

i really really liked deadpool you know what i didnt expect seriously i never fan character sense i hardly knew anything about him humor well violence seemed forced overdone trailers still i remained interested film i just never expected actually good until reviews arrived after most critics unexpectedly showered newest superhero movie praise i went cautiously optimistic but still fully prepared hate film

first thing i noticed how inventive storytelling film throws you into action first moment literally very first moment then goes back forth brilliant unexpected ways slowly unspool story insane but oddly charming antihero flashbacks fastforwards can annoying hell but when done right they can help render even somewhat simple story fresh exciting thats exactly how deadpool felt me right start like fresh if somewhat dirty jolt energy

action itself beautifully designed employing playful visuals using pretty much every camera technique available never feels repetitive pacing close perfection but probably key me liking film so much theres beating heart underneath all action carnage has lot do how brilliantly ryan reynolds portrays character great chemistry he has costar morena baccarin what came complete surprise me how unabashedly romantic deadpool love story film probably most sincere ive ever seen superhero movie gives film strong emotional core which so many these movies lack

humor which i initially feared would just nonstop juvenile wisecracks soon become distracting also works surprisingly well not every line every joke lands but thats beauty character they dont really need deadpool cant help himself long hes able breathe hell crack wise make fun himself those around him its clinical condition hes not standup comedian whose jokes need land hes madman albeit very entertaining one comedy his case born out tragedy

despite all my praise its not perfect film villain revenge tale could more memorable story itself bit too derivative really do its highly unconventional protagonist he insists hes not hero justice but its damn good first entry franchise will hopefully explore character his world much larger extent sequels its actually very important film another reason if deadpool financial success which point already clear will could play vital role how studios henceforth view financial prospects rrated superhero films well hopefully see more them future

there arent many movies i watched theatre twice  let alone same day but immediately after credits had rolled still pumped up rage against machine i queued up next screening matrix i so blown away film i feared probably rightly so i hadnt caught every detail what id just seen i later found out many my friends had had similar reaction film i know virtually no one who liked film didnt watch least twice its simply one those rare films so rich you just have watch them several times

structure style concept matrix groundbreaking marked first time visual style manga comic books anime such akira ghost shell had been successfully translated liveaction film apart blade runner which has totally different mood pace but also masterpiece visionary filmmaking there simply hadnt been anything even remotely like jawdropping action sequences have such raw gripping energy they feel like adrenalin overdose but unlike most action films they never overshadow story contrary they enhance make complete sense within universe

story itself i think one most original fascinating scifi tales youll likely ever see screen clearly inspired japanese anime manga yet also authors like isaac asimov philip k dick story about humanitys war against its own creation machines artificial intelligence have evolved point where they have become dominant species vastly superior their creators could take place same world blade runner terminator albeit several hundred years later but there also mythical even religious undercurrent story themes prophecy liberator even messiah make matrix transcend sciencefiction genre become even more unique

matrix watershed moment filmmaking  every respect  even though two inferior sequels have left bit stain film they cant distract what uncompromising hugely influential masterpiece scifi movies were released after matrix have tried very hard achieve similar look tone but original still owns them all 10 stars out 10

writing review matrix very hard thing me do because film means lot me therefore i want do film justice writing good review tell truth first time i saw film i enamored effects i remember thinking myself one most visually stunning films i had ever seen my life also having always been comic book fan fan films were larger than life transitional element story very appealing me probably heightened my enjoyment film very much wasnt until some time later after having seen film few times more i started think about film i recognized christian elements quite quickly but wasnt until i wrote actual 15page essay film i tapped into some philosophical religious elements made me appreciate film even more i wont say i have recognized all elements because film quite literally packed them

acting wise film works excellently i wont say there arent any issues because there but overall acting pretty flawless keanu reeves plays main character neo thomas anderson while he not perfect actor i think he does pretty good job matrix sequels he doesnt have longest lines which probably deliberate choice directors works because gives him better opportunity work posture facial expressions i must say overall his body language very good very clear well defined laurence fishbourne plays neos mentor morpheus he does excellent job his lines flow certain confidence style makes his character somewhat unique interesting carrieanne moss does good job well succeeds looking both cool sexy her leather outfit joe pantoliano critically underrated actor does brilliant job bringing his character cypher life i cant say much about him because his character pretty essential plot i certainly dont want spoil anyone gloria foster appears relatively small role will have greater significance following films she does very good job best acting provided hugo weaving however his portrayal agent smith really something watch him act out changes his character agent smith gains some human traits like anger sense dread hate eventually even sly sense humor mostly sequels two thumbs way up weaving who has created one finest screen villains all time

effects wise film simply stunning deservedly awarded oscar best effects regrettably cheated out nomination best film category ahead even star wars reason i think matrix deserves oscar best effects simply effects matrix more innovative than ones star wars just take look how many times effects have been spoofed youll probably agree effects also help symbolism film creating very dystopian atmosphere not unlike one seen blade runner works brilliantly film looks beautiful all times today 6 years later my god has already been 6 years effects still hold their ground against new science fiction films add effects brilliant editing you have visual masterpiece your hands very well done

reason i think matrix more reviewable than pretty much any other film story philosophical religious elements story because every viewing i catch something i didnt see previous time i watched without spoiling film i think i can mention few more obvious elements obviously film draws messiah myth neo clear reference jesus analogy his name neo one one but also hidden his other name thomas anderson first part his last name anderson comes greek andros meaning man combine second part his last name son add little creativity you will come up combination son man which title jesus came up about himself also first time we meet neo man calls him i quote youre my saviour man my own personal jesus christ doesnt get any more obvious than aside christianic elements film also gets its inspiration budhism gnosticism gnosis knowledge but also inspired plato his analogy cave jean baudrillards essay simulacra simulations explaining these elements would make review go forever so aside mentioning them i will not comment them further

based peter benchleys bestselling novel jaws centers around fictional north atlantic resort island amity which finds itself terrorized enormous great white shark our hero martin brody new york cop who took job chief amity pd get his family out city then finds himself midst unprecedented crisis none his prior experience has prepared him remains young christine watkins found beach apparent victim shark attackchrissie watkins death scene opening movie one most legendary history film chief brody wants close beaches but refused permission mayor larry vaughn murray hamilton amity selectmen all whom fear news shark attack off amity will threaten summer tourist trade which town depends its very survival mayor his lackies persuade chief brody such incidents always isolated inexperienced such matters he grudgingly agrees keep quiet

consequently shark kills again again chief brody eventually finds himself dealing both his own moral guilt agreeing hush up first shark attack enormous human social catastrophe which appears his sole responsibility help comes first form matt hooper richard dreyfuss role propelled him stardom icthyologist oceanographer dispatched amity lend his expertise together hooper brody struggle vain against both shark mayor vaughan who certain keeping beaches open sake towns economy his own realestate business worth gamble

finally brody hooper charter expedition enigmatic vaguely malevolent quint robert shaw amitys most feared respected shark hunter find kill shark save town financial disaster what ensues epic archetypal man vs beast quest would make herman melville joseph campbell proud our shark turns out way above average size terrifically swift powerful uncannily smart boot hooper scientist awestruck having encountered bigfoot sea quint crafty fisherman serious chip his shoulder against sharks realizes he has met ultimate test his skills brody who swims poorly afraid water must overcome abject fear disorientation just maintain his composure

over past decade marvel has earned itself benefit doubt studio has consistently delivered smart funny brave films both embrace transcend their comicbook origins 18 blockbuster movies produced since iron man first blasted off into stratosphere 2008 have not only reinvented superhero films genre theyve helped legitimise indeed marvels two most recent films thor ragnarok black panther have received kind accolades usually reserved edgy arthouse flicks

yet its perfectly reasonable apprehensive about avengers infinity war blockbuster film thats been ten years making its plot hinted scattered throughout 18 other movies features 30 so characters each their own complex backstories motivations all them coming together bid stop giant purple alien dude destroying universe sounds ridiculous feels impossible

but thats precisely what makes final product such monumental achievement masterfully directed anthony joe russo infinity war bold brainy filmmaking its very best kind will lift your spirits blow your mind shatter your soul occasionally same scene demonstrates epic scale what marvel has known all along special effects tightly choreographed action there serve story all its blockbuster spectacle theres almost too much film works because its anchored heart humour humanity its characters

outset its immediately clear neither films directors nor screenwriters christopher markus stephen mcfeely interested playing safe most other superhero films bled high stakes hero title might suffer untold trauma but its supersafe bet he she will make end alive theres no such guarantee here within first ten minutes we confronted dark twisted depths which thanos his acolytes black order will sink order achieve their goals death well genuine loss sacrifice intrinsic narrative drumbeat drives infinity war ever forward film all better
